english_translation: Narrated from al-Zuhri, from Salim, from ibn Umar: The Messenger of Allah ﷺ stood upon the minbar and said: Here is the land of trials (referring to the east), and where the horn of Satan appears - or he said: the horn of the sun. And [separate chain]: From Zayd ibn Aslam, I do not know it except as mursal: He said: Allah has not created any creation except He created what overcomes it. His mercy overcomes His anger, and charity extinguishes sin like water extinguishes fire. And Allah created the earth and it flourished and became decorated, saying: What overcomes me? So He created mountains and made them firm. The mountains said: We overcame the earth, what overcomes us? So He created iron. Iron said: We overcame the mountains, what overcomes us? So He created water. Water said: We overcame fire, what overcomes us? So He created wind. He placed it in the clouds. Wind said: We overcame water, what overcomes us? So He created man building structures that wind cannot penetrate. Man said: We overcame wind, what overcomes us? So He created death. Death said: We overcame man, what overcomes us? Allah said: I overcome you.

english_translation: Narrated from Zayd ibn Aslam who said: There was a dispute between Abu Dharr and a man from the Muslims. Abu Dharr reviled him (insulted his mother) by mentioning a slave woman he had in the days of ignorance. This reached the Prophet ﷺ, who said: Indeed in you, O Abu Dharr, is a quality of (pre-Islamic) pride. Nothing makes one better than another - black or green - until your companion is pleased with you. I set out seeking him and he saw me before I saw him. He said: Peace be upon you, O Abu Dharr. I came and greeted him and said: Forgive me. He said: May Allah forgive you. Then I came to the Prophet ﷺ and mentioned that to him and informed him that he was pleased with me and had sought forgiveness for me. I said: Forgive me, O Messenger of Allah. He said: May Allah forgive your companion. Then I said: Forgive me, O Messenger of Allah. He said: May Allah forgive your companion. I said: Forgive me, O Messenger of Allah - I do not know except that in the third time he said: Allah has forgiven you.

He said: This is in the Path of Allah. Then Abu Bakr stood and gave, then Umar stood and gave, then the Muhajirin and Ansar stood and gave. The face of the Messenger of Allah ﷺ brightened until we saw the brightness in his cheeks. Then the Prophet ﷺ said: Whoever establishes a good Sunnah in Islam that is acted upon after him will have for him similar to the reward of those who act upon it without any diminishment from their reward. Whoever establishes in Islam a bad Sunnah that is acted upon after him will have upon him a burden similar to the burden of those who act upon it without any diminishment from their burden.

english_translation: Narrated from Ibn Tawus, from his father (Tawus) who said: A man borrowed from a man one hundred dinars, or more or less. The lender said: I will not lend to you until you bring me a guarantor. The borrower said: I cannot find anyone to guarantee for me, but for you Allah is a guarantor and surety that I will repay you. So he lent to him. The lender then traveled by sea. When the time for repayment came, he was unable to travel to him, and the sea separated them. He took a piece of wood and drilled it, then placed the dinars in it, wrote a letter to him and placed it with the dinars. Then he sealed it. Then he said: O Allah, You took responsibility for me, and whoever pays the guarantor is absolved. Indeed, I am paying to you. He threw the wood into the sea, and the wind or the waves buffeted it back and forth. He said: If I had taken this wood for firewood for my family. So he took the wood. When he entered his house, he broke it and found the dinars and the letter, and it was from his companion. Time passed until his companion came and confronted him. He said: By Allah, indeed Allah knows that I have repaid you. He was silent towards him and went with him to count it. When he brought them out, he said: By Allah, indeed Allah knows that I have repaid you. He said: How did you repay? He informed him how he had done it. He said: Then Allah has repaid it for you.

chainIssues: This hadith is mursal - attributed to the Prophet ﷺ through Tawus (a tabi'i) who could not have directly heard from the Prophet ﷺ
Ibn Tawus and Tawus are both reliable narrators (thiqah thabt)
The missing link is presumably an unidentified companion between Tawus and the Prophet ﷺ

english_translation: Narrated from Ibn Tawus, from his father Tawus: A man with four sons became ill. One son said: Either you nurse him and get no inheritance, or I nurse him for no inheritance. They said: Go ahead and nurse him for no inheritance. He nursed him until he died, taking nothing from his wealth. He was visited in a dream and told to go to a place and take one hundred dinars. He asked in his dream: Is there blessing in it? They said: No. He refused and told his wife, who encouraged him to take it. He refused. That evening, he dreamed again about taking ten dinars, but again was told no blessing. He refused. On the third night, he was told to take one dinar, and this time was told: Yes, there is blessing in it. He took the dinar to the market and found a man with two fish asking one dinar. He bought them. At home, when he split them, he found a pearl in each belly like none the people had seen. The king sought to buy one pearl but found it only with him. He sold it for thirty camels of gold. The king said: This needs a partner. They came to him offering double the price for the other pearl, and he gave it.
